fields.summary: Provide the Jira Server Mobile app for Blackberry Dynamic Apps.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Log Analyzer Periodic Scan mail notifications are still being sent even when outgoing mail is disabled. This should not be the case since this mail notification relies on the outgoing mail to be enabled for it to be sent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the *Log analyzer* tab in Troubleshooting and Support Tools.
 # Click on *Periodic Scan*,
 # Set the Periodic scan time and check the enable box.
 # Disable Outgoing Mail.

h3. Expected Results

Log Analyzer Periodic Scan mail notifications will not be sent even when outgoing mail is disabled.
h3. Actual Results

Log Analyzer Periodic Scan mail notifications will be sent.
h3. Workaround
 # Go to the *Log analyzer* tab in Troubleshooting and Support Tools.
 # Click on *Periodic Scan*,
 # Uncheck the *Enable* box.
fields.summary: Log Analyzer Periodic Scan mail notifications are still being sent even when outgoing mail is disabled.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, only admins are able to perform full CSV imports. For all other users in the instance, the access is limited to the *Bulk Create* functionality, which allows issue creation from CSV files. The *Bulk Create* option is limited, as it doesn't allow for fields like *Resolution* and *Status* to be imported due to the nature of the functionality.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a Global Permission which can grant user/group access to the *External System Import*.

h3. Why this is important

This will allow users that are not System Administrators in the instance to import some of the fields not supported by the Bulk Create functionality. With the permission, admins will be able to dictate which users in the instance will have access to this functionality.
fields.summary: Allow admins to grant user access to the External System Import functionality

fields.description:
h4. Current state

When a new user account is created in Jira, the user key (used as an immutable foreign key in the database) is the same as username, lowercased. For example, user {{Admin}} will get a user key {{admin}}. If there’s a naming conflict, the user key will be set to a value like {{ID10100}}.

This is problematic, because usernames are often based on full names. As a result, user keys contain personal information that is later scattered throughout the entire database, making GDPR compliance harder.
h4. Expected state

User keys in Jira do not contain any personal information, but are somewhat random.
fields.summary: Do not base user keys on usernames

fields.description:
Currently, Kanban boards are configured with a hard coded 30 seconds refresh interval to check for board updates. If the board usage in the instance is high, and users tend to leave on for prolonged periods of time (e.g. as wallboards), boards will continuously poll Jira for updates, with each poll being a somewhat expensive operation on the Jira server resources.

For such environments, it would make sense to decrease the automatic polling interval to decrease the load on the server. 

h3. Workaround

Currently changing the automatic refresh interval is only possible by repackaging the greenhopper file with the updated refresh value:

h4. Compile an updated greenhopper file:

# Unpack the _jira-greenhopper-plugin-*.jar_ plugin from {{$JIRAHOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} 
# Update 3 files {{includes/js/rapid/ops}} to change the interval to 60 seconds:
## *Poller.js*: {{DEFAULT_INTERVAL = 60000}} (was {{DEFAULT INTERVAL = 30000}});
## *Poller-source.js*: {{DEFAULT_INTERVAL=60000}} (was {{DEFAULT INTERVAL = 30000}});
## *Poller-min.js*: {{var r=60000}} (was {{var r=3e4}})
# Repackage the JAR file

h4. Replace the original file with the modified version

# Stop Jira instance.
# Replace the original greenhopper file in folder {{$JIRAHOME/plugins/installed-plugins}} with the modified version (take backup)
# Remove the file {{$JIRAHOME/plugins/install-app-info/jira-software-application.properties}} (this is needed to force Jira to reload greenhopper plugin from the source)
# Start Jira instance
fields.summary: Make the automatic Kanban board refresh interval configurable
Operation on worklogs may results in inconsistent timespent when done in parallel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bulk transition of issues that are associated to more than 1 workflow only allows a single set of radio button action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Two workflows, WA and WB
# In the Workflow Scheme, WA is associated with Tasks and WB is associated with Bugs
# Use the bulk edit function, select a Task and a Bug and choose to transition issues
# On the transition screen (see screenshot) there is only a single set of radio buttons, which only allows you to select a single workflow transition
!bulk_transition_multiple_workflow.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Radio buttons for each workflow can be selected to be transitioned, so you can select an appropriate transition for each workflow.

h3. Actual Results
Only 1 set of radio buttons can be selected at a single point in time. 

h3.Workaround
Go through the bulk transition wizard twice, once per each workflow.
fields.summary: Bulk transition with multiple workflows uses a single set of radio buttons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to resolve issues in Workflows with current steps, the integrity checker fails to resolve these issues 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # issue workflow id somehow becomes out of sync with os_currentstep (db corruption, race condition during move?) 
 # attempt to fix via the integrity checker 

h3. Expected Results
Workflow is set to a correct step and resolved in integrity checker 
h3. Actual Results
Integrity checker says it resolves the issue but the issue will still be stuck in "dead" workflow


h3. Workaround

Move the issue via the more menu to another issue type then back to the current issue type, this will reassociate the correct workflow with the issue.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker does not resolve current step issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Selecting a user with some fields in Jira does not work for some users, whose name matches the following:
 # A short name & username with only 2 characters in sequence.
 # There are lots of other users whose name contains exactly the same character sequence.
 # The user picker field returns only a limited number of users based on autocomplete, (usually the 50 first match).
 # In alphabetical order, the name is later than 50. (20. for some Jira fields) in the list returned by the autocomplete feature.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user called li.li and li.la
 # Head to Project Settings > Users & Roles.
 # Click *Add User to a role*.
 # Search for the user li.li

h3. Expected Results

Results will return for the user 'li.li'.
h3. Actual Results

The result will show both 'li.la' and 'li.li' eventhough the search specified was 'li.li'. If 'li.li' appears last in a list of 50+ users, the user will not appear in the search at all.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding a user to a role in a project, user picker displays less relevant users when a surname is short (i.e. two letters) and there are other users that have those letters somewhere as part of their username.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a linked issue from More -> Create linked issue, Jira Service Desk always defaults the Link Type option to causes, which is taken from the Problem/Incident link type created by JSD from Issue Linking administration page.

This can be seen in the HAR file where the request explicitly looks for 'causes':
{code}
this.$element.find("label[for='issuelinks-linktype']").text("Created issue");
this.$element.find("label[for='issuelinks-issues']").text("Linked issues");
this.$element.find("#qf-field-issuelinks .description").text("Search for issues to link to from the one you\'re creating.");
this.$element.find("#issuelinks-linktype").val("causes")}
{code}

If 'causes' does not exist in the Issue Linking administration page (deleted or modified by the user), Jira defaults to show a blank option. 

The behavior of first defaulting to 'causes' and subsequently defaulting to blank if 'causes' cannot be found is not consistent with the option that appears on other issue linking methods (Eg: Jira issue creation, where it defaults to the first item on the Issue Linking administration page). 

h3. Environment
Jira 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to any Jira Service Desk issue and click on More -> Create linked issue.
# Observe that the Created Issue option defaults to 'causes'.
# Navigate to Issue Linking administration page and delete 'causes' (Problem/Incident) 
# Navigate back any Jira Service Desk issue and click on More -> Create linked issue.
# Observe that the Created Issue option defaults to blank.

h3. Expected Results
We expect Jira to default to the first item on the list instead of blank.

h3. Actual Results
Jira defaults to blank.

h3. Workaround
A workaround is to create a new link type and ensure 'causes' is Outward Description or Inward Description. This would default the option to 'causes'. However, no workaround exists yet to default to the first option on the list to make it consistent with other issue linking method in Jira.
fields.summary: Deleting 'causes' on Issue Linking administration defaults Created Issue link to blank.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Noting in our documentation ["Search syntax for text fields"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/search-syntax-for-text-fields-939937723.html] we state:
{quote}
Note: All query terms in Jira are not case sensitive.
{quote}

However when using the 'ORDER BY' function on a text field the sorting appears to be using a ASCII sort function which causes the sorting of uppercase and lowercase letters separately and sort punctuation marks and symbols in various places between numerals and letters, for example, "Z" precedes "a"  

A Reference to ASCII ordering can be found at:
- http://www.asciitable.com/

Using the order of character sets designed for computer sorting does not necessarily produce a sort sequence that is acceptable for human readable fields such as a text field where having values such as a,A,b,B,1,Z,# in the fields would be sorted as #,1,A,B,Z,a,b in ASCII so that the upper case A & B are separated from lowercase a & b where alphabetically the uppercase and lowercase letters should be grouped together.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create multiple issue adding one of these values in each issues Summary {{A, a, B, b, #, Z, 1, 2}}
# In JQL search add in 'ORDER BY summary'

h3. Expected Results
The issues are sorted with Alphanumeric sort order of Special characters then numbers, then letters: {{#, 1, 2, A, a, B, b, Z}}

h3. Actual Results
Issues sorted by ASCII value priority {{#, 1, 2, A, B, Z, a, b}}
!Screen Shot 2019-08-16 at 4.41.55 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3.Note:
IN ASCII sort, the special characters for a dash "-" and underscore "_" occure between Uppercase and lowercase and are not grouped with other special characters causing an additional layer of confusion

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 'ORDER BY' in JQL on text Fields sorts by ASCII values causing upper and lowercase to be separated

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
The JQL searcher in the Issue Linking (search for an issue) is not the full version. Hence it is not able to use the function like ORDER BY. 

 !Screenshot 2019-08-16 at 8.57.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screenshot 2019-08-16 at 8.58.33 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2019-08-16 at 8.58.48 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Enable the searcher into the full version in Issue Navigator. 

h3. *Why this is important*
This is important as this will improve the searching capabilities without extra manual intervention. 
 
h3. *Workaround* 
-
fields.summary: Enable full JQL searcher in Issue Linking : search for an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Setting up end-to-end SSL/HTTPS from proxy up until the application can benefit from performance improvements when using APR connector. The APR connector is said to be using OpenSSL while NIO uses Java for handling SSL.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for APR connector from Tomcat https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.5-doc/apr.html
fields.summary: Add support for APR Connector in Jira

fields.description:
I see issue JRASERVER-43001Feature Request: Links on Jira-Boards to Confluence-Pages was marked as resolved, however, the information provided in that ticket doesn't address all the possible use cases. 

We have Jira Data Center. Not all of our projects are software projects. I have more than one project where the "project type" = "business". In this case, when you create a Jira board, the board is not linked to the project like we see for software project types. So, the links feature of the project is not visible. Further more, the idea case would be to have a single Confluence page link below the Board title that points to the directions for how to use the board (e.g. explanation of workflow, issue types, card colors, etc.).
fields.summary: Link to Confluence Page on Jira Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In some cases due to JSWSERVER-16473 Jira ends up with a _NULL_ value in the _issuenum_ column of {{jiraissue}} table,

Current schema:
{noformat}
                  Table "public.jiraissue"
        Column        |           Type           | Modifiers
----------------------+--------------------------+-----------
 id                   | numeric(18,0)            | not null
 pkey                 | character varying(255)   |
 issuenum             | numeric(18,0)            |
 project              | numeric(18,0)            |
...
Indexes:
    "pk_jiraissue" PRIMARY KEY, btree (id)
    "issue_assignee" btree (assignee)
    "issue_created" btree (created)
    "issue_duedate" btree (duedate)
    "issue_proj_num" btree (issuenum, project)
    "issue_proj_status" btree (project, issuestatus)
    "issue_reporter" btree (reporter)
    "issue_resolutiondate" btree (resolutiondate)
    "issue_updated" btree (updated)
    "issue_votes" btree (votes)
    "issue_watches" btree (watches)
    "issue_workflow" btree (workflow_id)
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
Prevent the data consistency problem by adding *not null* constraint for _issuenum_  column for {{jiraissue}} table. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Add null constraint for issuenum  column to jiraissue table

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when editing an Issue Security Scheme or Project Permissions, all custom fields does not appear. For example, we can't choose calculated fields from third-party add ons(such as 'Calculated (scripted) Single-User Field from [Jira Misc Custom Fields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27136/jira-misc-custom-fields])' as an option when selecting "User custom field value".

We would like for the ability to allow all custom fields to be added as a selection when editing Issue Security levels.
fields.summary: All custom fields should be added as a selection when editing Issue Security levels and Project Permissions.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira DC can insert stale custom field values into its Lucene index while replicating index changes from another node(s). 
This happens due to receiving node reading from the stale {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} cache. 
This will cause JQL search not returning the expected result on the affected node. 

+Notes:+
* System fields are not affected since they are not using same cache. 

h3. Environment
The problem is visible in DC setup with 1+ nodes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* create the issueA on a node A
** the less load DC has the more likely the problem will be reproduced. 
* edit a custom field with "value A"
* wait until this issue is replicated to other node(s)
* edit the same custom field once again and set "value B"
* wait until this issue is replicated to other node(s)

h3. Expected Results
* All nodes see "value B" in the index. 
* JQL search "CF = value B" shows the issueA

h3. Actual Results
* Other nodes see stale CF value - "value A"
* JQL search _"CF = value B"_ doen't show the issueA
* JQL search _"CF = value A"_ shows the issueA
** Opening issueA will show the correct value, since it will be loaded directly from DB

h3. Notes
* _NodeReindexServiceThread_ doesn't clear thread-local request caches on each consecutive run of reIndex.
* Problem is caused by JRASERVER-68806. _NodeReindexServiceThread_ is caching 10 last issues, so when reindexing replication happens for the same issue it uses the old value to create Lucene doc. Since Lucene contains the old value, JQL search doesn't reflect the change. 
* Since {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} cache stores 10 issues by default, creating or modifying 10 distinct issues with CF on nodeA will kick issueA out of the cache on all nodes. The next update of issueA on any other node will be replicated properly to the index.
* Jira 8+ is not affected.

h3. Workaround
* Running Full reindex will temporarily fix the consistency problem.
fields.summary: Jira can index stale custom field values in DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It appears that JIRA will append a user with "#1" in {{app_user}} table if a User that is using a Special Character is renamed to use the normal one e.g. "user.tést" to "user.test"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA with SQL Server database with the supported collation.
# Prepare an AD and create a user called "user.tést"
# Integrate JIRA with the AD and sync it.
# Clarify that the user is created.
# In the AD, change the "Logon Name" to "user.test"
(i) In case that AD complains, change it to something else first before the above and don't let JIRA sync the AD before it.
# After it is changed, Sync the AD again in JIRA.

h3. Expected Result
JIRA will change the lower_user_name to "user.test" in the {{app_user}} table.

h3. Actual Resutl
JIRA will change the lower_user_name to "user.test" in the {{app_user}} table but appended with "#1"

h3. Note
- Tested with SQL Server 2012 and 2017 with both supported collation
- In the logs:
{noformat}
2019-08-15 17:56:58,901 Caesium-2-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] Incremental synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] was unexpectedly interrupted, falling back to a full synchronisation
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Trying to rename user 'user.tést' but no user key is mapped.
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserKeyStoreImpl.renameUser(UserKeyStoreImpl.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUserDao.rename(OfBizUserDao.java:524)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.rename(DelegatingUserDao.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.IndexedUserDao.rename(IndexedUserDao.java:300)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.rename(DelegatingUserDao.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.SwitchingUserDao.rename(SwitchingUserDao.java:30)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Most probably an issue will happen towards the user, the following KB should fix the issue:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-login-fails-with-user-exists-but-has-no-unique-key-mapping-373261121.html
fields.summary: Renaming problem with Special Character in SQL Server

fields.description:
In 7.11.2, the available actions in Manage Subscriptions are the following:
 * Edit
 * Delete
 * Run Now

Adding an Enable/Disable toggle will let administrators pause email notifications for the time being and reenable them without deleting and recreating the subscriptions from scratch
fields.summary: Add Enable/Disable Action in Manage Subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73311].
  {panel}
h3. Issue Summary
Currently the "User email visibility" setting affects webhooks by determining whether or not user emails are sent with the message body.   However, the behaviour is inconsistent as certain webhook actions will include email address, while others do not.

In this case, setting "Show to logged in users only" will result in:
* "webhookEvent": "jira:issue_updated". - "issue_event_type_name": "issue_commented"
** Email Displayed - YES
* "webhookEvent": "comment_created".
** Email Displayed - NO

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Jira Admin > System > General Settings*
# Set the "User email visibility" to be "Show to logged in users only"
# Configure webhooks to trigger on "Comment created" and "Issue updated"
** This can be configured to a site like https://requestbin.com for testing
# Trigger both these event types:
** Add a comment into an issue
** Edit the issue and change a field value
# Examine the results

h3. Expected Results
That both webhooks will show the same user data.  Either have email address or not.

h3. Actual Results
"Comment created" will not show the user email, but "Issue updated" will.
| !comment-created.png|thumbnail! | vs | !issue-updated.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Notes
Have not tested all potential webhook events for this behaviour.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User email visibility is inconsistent with Webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This setting is located in: *Jira Admin > System > General Configuration*

When editing "User email visibility", the description shows:
bq. Indicates who can view user email on the user profile page

This is misleading as it actually various operations in Jira, including:
* Webhooks - it will determine if user email is sent with the body
* REST API - JRASERVER-61565

h3. Expected Results
The description of the setting will accurately affect what functions will be affected.

h3. Actual Results
Current it only indicates that user profiles are affected.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Configuration for User email visibility is misleading

fields.description:
h3. JiraEventExecutorFactory does not provide Jira Thread Local context

BB 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a post-function to trigger a webhook

Issue transitioned on BB merge without exceptions.

fields.description:
A support.zip contains values of some JMX instruments exposed by Jira. However, this data is more useful over time, with a history/baseline rather than snapshot values, as the rate of change of these metrics may actually provide value during troubleshooting.

*Suggestion:* 

Collect values of JMX instruments already reported in support.zip to a separate log file periodically, including the ability to add/remove JMX instruments to the list of instruments to be monitored.
fields.summary: Collect JMX instrument data periodically and store it in separate log file for performance troubleshooting and monitoring

fields.description:
h3. Definition
There are times that the batch notifications are not being sent out and there's no way it can be monitored.

h3. Suggestion
It would be great if this feature can be monitored or some sort of a HealthCheck or Processing/Connectivity logs
fields.summary: Monitor Batch Notification

fields.description:
Currently the [atlassian/jira-software|https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/jira-software] image allows you to set connector settings through Docker environmental variables, however, we would like to configure multiple connectors as it is good practice to have a backdoor connector for instance administration.
h3. Workaround.

Create a custom Docker build from the base [https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/jira-software] image, and COPY the desired server.xml into /opt/atlassian/etc/server.xml.j2. Startup will copy that over and it will not be altered by the merge field functionality. 

Example Dockerfile:
{code}
FROM atlassian/jira-software:latest
COPY my-custom-server.xml /opt/atlassian/etc/server.xml.j2
{code}
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like the ability to define multiple tomcat connectors for my Jira Docker deployment

fields.description:
Currently (v8) on a Kanban or Current Sprint board  transitions other than drag-drop are cumbersome and slow. To select a transition where multiple transitions exist to a single status, or select a transition to a status in the same column, the user has to either:
 * Click on the card > (wait for Issue detail view to render) > dots menu > More Actions > select transition
 * Open the full detail view (wait for Full issue view to render) > select the transition, possibly by clicking the Workflow dropdown

These are all 4+ clicks plus render time. To be forced to do this for a transition feels like punishment for using workflows with more than a few statuses and/or transitions. Not every business process can or should be simplified to that degree.

I suggest that transitions be offered in the Alt-Click menu for the card. This would reduce the picking a transition to a 2 click process. It would also potentially solve the "transition to the same column" issue. Bonus points to the dev if they putting the To status next to the transition name in that Alt-click menu.

This may be an enhancement request elsewhere. Please link if it is.
fields.summary: Add available transitions to Card view alt-click menu on Kanban and Active Sprint boards

fields.description:
I would like to have the feature that will show who are the users currently viewing the JIRA ticket that I am looking at that particular time. 
I have looked into Atlassian Community and this seems like the only related post that I can find : https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/How-do-you-see-who-s-looking-at-an-issue-i-e-viewing-the-issue/qaq-p/550302
The plugin suggested has been archived as well.
It will be great if we can have this feature in JIRA someday in the future.

Thanks and Regards,
Sam
fields.summary: Show who is Viewing the JIRA ticket Real Time

fields.description:
When the user is using the Bulk edit of issues, the fields on 'Move Issues' screen (step 3) do not follow the order of any screen scheme and they also don't follow the ID order from the database, they seem to be randomly ordered.

The request is to have a configuration option or scheme where you select this order.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a WebHook is triggered by Issue Updated event, the JSON body contains all the information about the issue details but none about whether it was updated from GUI or API.

In certain cases, it would be useful to be able to tell whether an event was triggered from GUI or API, so that further actions can be taken by the WebHook app.

h3. Suggestion
When a WebHook is triggered, the JSON body should contain additional info about whether the event was triggered from GUI or API.

This should be implemented for all supported events.
fields.summary: Ability to detect if an event listened by WebHook was triggered from GUI or API

fields.summary: Ability to filter linked issues by type in view column configurations

fields.description:
There are changes that a system admin can make that are not logged in the Audit Log. These include configuration changes to system-level settings like changing date and time format. Without seeing who made the change, organizations have difficulty tracking admin activity for potential security risks.

 
These settings include but are not limited to:

* jira.date.picker.java.format
* jira.date.picker.javascript.format
* jira.date.time.picker.java.format
* jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format
* jira.projectkey.pattern
fields.summary: Include more information on the Audit Log

fields.description:

If a company works with Jira Software and Jira ServiceDesk, and uses a lot of different plugins. There are multiple panels displayed even though they are used only for few projects.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option for hiding / Showing panels on issue screens view per project. 

h3. Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Hide / Show panels on detailed issue view screen per project

fields.description:
As I said [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Disable-horizontal-scrollbar-on-board/qaq-p/1063514?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=kudos_question&utm_content=post]:

after upgrading from 7.13 to 8.1 all our boards got horizontal scrollbars. Is there a way to disable them? We have a very wide board for one project and in 7.13 it was just fine as it was. Now i can't see 50% of columns without scrolling.

Please provide "disable" button for this.
fields.summary: Disable horizontal scrollbar on board

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently, granting / revoking permission can only be done to current permission scheme.
If we would like to grant same permission to many schemes, we would need to iterate through all these schemes.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement permission modification screen where user could grant a permission to multiple permission schemes at once.
fields.summary: Grant / revoke permission within multiple schemes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using square brackets in the file name will cause the generated link to be broken after upload. 

h3. Environment
-

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an attachment with square bracket (" [ " & " ] "). 
# While commenting on an issue, upload the attachment. 
# You will see the link is broken as shown in *_Actual Results_*. 

h3. Expected Results
 !Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 7.05.16 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 7.04.20 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
- The file gets uploaded nonetheless. 
- This is no filename spaces bug regression as an attachment with spaces in their name attached fine: 
 !Screenshot 2019-08-12 at 7.04.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

*+Workaround 1+*
Use another markup syntax but escaping the square bracket with a backslash symbol: 
{noformat}
[filename to be displayed by escaping the square bracket | link to the file by copy-paste from the attachment section] 
{noformat}

Example:
{noformat}
[some file with \[square bracket\].msg|http://baseURL/secure/attachment/12345/some%20file%20with%20%5Bsquare%20bracket%5D.msg]
{noformat}

*+Workaround 2+*
Upgrade to JIRA 7.13.4 (tested alright) and above.
fields.summary: Using square bracket in file name will cause the generated link to be broken after upload

fields.description: The login.jsp resource in Jira before version 7.13.4, and from version 8.0.0 before version 8.2.2  allows remote attackers to enumerate usernames via an information disclosure vulnerability.
fields.summary: User enumeration in the login.jsp resource - CVE-2019-8448

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

The /rest/api/latest/groupuserpicker resource in Jira before version 8.4.0 allows remote attackers to enumerate usernames via an information disclosure vulnerability.
h3. Workaround

If upgrading Jira to 8.4.0 is not an option for now, then a temporary workaround consists in blocking this API endpoint on the Tomcat side by forcing it to return a 403 error.

The steps are:
 # Add to the file *<jira-installation-directory>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/urlrewrite.xml* the rule below, which will return a 403 error whenever someone who is not authenticated via Cookie (IE, normal browser access, or cookie based API calls) calls */rest/api/latest/groupuserpicker*:
{code:java}
    <rule>
     	<condition type="session-attribute" name="seraph_defaultauthenticator_user" operator="notequal">.+</condition>
     	<from>^(?s)/rest/api/.*/groupuserpicker</from>
     	<set type="status">403</set>
        	<to>null</to>
    </rule>
{code}

 # Re-start Jira
fields.summary: User enumeration through the groupuserpicker api resource - CVE-2019-8449

fields.description: Various templates of the Optimization plugin in Jira before version 7.13.6, and from version 8.0.0 before version 8.4.0 allow remote attackers who have permission to manage custom fields to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the name of a custom field.
fields.summary: XSS in various templates of the Optimization plugin - CVE-2019-8450

fields.description: The AccessLogFilter class in Jira before version 8.4.0 allows remote anonymous attackers to learn details about other users, including their username, via an information expose through caching vulnerability when Jira is configured with a reverse Proxy and or a load balancer with caching or a CDN.
fields.summary: CDN caching can lead to leak of user information - CVE-2019-14997

fields.description: The /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest resource in Jira before version 8.4.0 allows remote attackers to access the content of internal network resources via a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability due to a logic bug in the JiraWhitelist class.
fields.summary: SSRF in the /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest resource - CVE-2019-8451

fields.description: The /rest/api/1.0/render resource in Jira before version 8.4.0 allows remote anonymous attackers to determine if an attachment with a specific name exists and if an issue key is valid via a missing permissions check.
fields.summary: Disclosure of issue key validity & issue attachment names in the render api resource - CVE-2019-14995

fields.description: The Webwork action Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection implementation in Jira before version 8.4.0 allows remote attackers to bypass its protection via "cookie tossing" a CSRF cookie from a subdomain of a Jira instance.
fields.summary: "Cookie Tossing" CSRF weakness against subdomains - CVE-2019-14998

fields.description: The FilterPickerPopup.jspa resource in Jira before version 7.13.7, and from version 8.0.0 before version 8.3.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the searchOwnerUserName parameter.
fields.summary: XSS in the FilterPickerPopup.jspa resource through the searchOwnerUserName parameter - CVE-2019-14996

fields.description:
In Jira 8+, when the Labels field is not included on the 'View Issue' screen, you cannot edit the field inline, but also does not do what pre-8 versions used to - which is redirected you to another page where you edit the field.

We would like the redirect to be put back as it was before, as we utilized it in this way.
fields.summary: Rollback new behavior of Labels field in Jira8+ when the field is not included on the 'View Issue' screen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Permissions are set to allow a user that is not signed in to create a ticket and assign the report through the user picker. Recent releases of Jira prevent this action unless the user signs in.
h3. Environment

Jira 7.13.3+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a new install of Jira 7.12.x
 # Set the global permission "browse users" to anyone and the project permissions "create issues," "modify reporter," "browse projects," & "assign issues"
 # Log out
 # Attempt to create an issue and assign it to a user in the instance
 # Complete issue creation
 # Set up a new install of Jira 7.13.5
 # Grant the same permissions
 # Log out
 # Attempt to create an issue and assign it to a user

h3. Expected Results

Same results as 7.12.x
h3. Actual Results

An error prompting for sign in (401 error)
h3. Notes

An unintended symptom of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69242
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Cannot select reporter when creating an issue while not signed in.

fields.description: The MigratePriorityScheme resource in Jira before version 8.3.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the priority icon url of an issue priority.
fields.summary: XSS in the MigratePriorityScheme resource - CVE-2019-11584

fields.description: The startup.jsp resource in Jira before version 7.13.6, from version 8.0.0 before version 8.2.3, and from version 8.3.0 before version 8.3.2 allows remote attackers to redirect users to a different website which they may use as part of performing a phishing attack via an open redirect.
fields.summary: Open redirect in startup.jsp - CVE-2019-11585

fields.description: The AddResolution.jspa resource in Jira before version 7.13.6, from version 8.0.0 before version 8.2.3,  and from version 8.3.0 before version 8.3.2 allows remote attackers to create new resolutions via a Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability.
fields.summary: The AddResolution.jspa resource was vulnerable to CSRF - CVE-2019-11586

fields.description: Various exposed resources of the ViewLogging class in Jira before version 7.13.6, from version 8.0.0 before version 8.2.3, and from version 8.3.0 before version 8.3.2 allow remote attackers to modify various settings via Cross-site request forgery (CSRF).

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Mail handler fails to attach a file to Jira issue if the file's name is unavailable such as due to:
 * filename is not specified
 * filename is improperly encoded

You can reproduce the problem with a scenario like:
 # Create a JSD project
 # Send an email inquiry which contains an attachment without specifying the file's name
 ** script: [^jpns27074.zip]


No error is recorded at audit log in web UI or application log:

 !jpns27074-audit-log.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

The file should be attached to the issue even without filename. The name can be something like timestamp or a sha1 fingerprint of the payload.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to upload attachment without filename via email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This applies to the documentation at: 
[Live monitoring using the JMX interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/live-monitoring-using-the-jmx-interface-939707304.html]

See the section *Monitoring Jira remotely*

For customers who use {{JAVA_OPTS}} (instead of {{CATALINA_OPTS}}) within {{setenv.sh/.bat}}, our documentation is not so helpful.

h3. Expected Results

The syntax for {{JAVA_OPTS}} would be included in addition to {{CATALINA_OPTS}}

h3. Actual Results

Only {{CATALINA_OPTS}} is mentioned in the article

h3. Notes
For more context see serverfault article [Tomcat : Where to configure jmx JAVA_OPTS or CATALINA_OPTS|https://serverfault.com/questions/641103/tomcat-where-to-configure-jmx-java-opts-or-catalina-opts]

h3. Workaround

Add the following arguments to {{setenv.bat}} or {{setenv.sh}}:

For Windows, {{setenv.bat}}
JAVA_OPTS=-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote %JAVA_OPTS%
JAVA_OPTS=-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=8099 %JAVA_OPTS%
JAVA_OPTS=-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false %JAVA_OPTS%

For Linux, {{setenv.sh}}
JAVA_OPTS="-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote ${JAVA_OPTS}"
JAVA_OPTS="-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.port=8099 ${JAVA_OPTS}"
JAVA_OPTS="-Dcom.sun.management.jmxremote.authenticate=false ${JAVA_OPTS}"
export JAVA_OPTS
fields.summary: Documentation bug: Missing arguments for JMX Monitoring article for modifying setenv.sh/.bat

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For a user's public profile Activity Stream gadget, the order of the activities loads in a weird order, missing a few days that will only eventually appear once you click *Show More* a few times.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.9.0 - Jira 8.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to the public profile of a user and check the Activity Stream. It will appear a few activities of some days. Clicking Show More a few times, it will eventually show activities from day in between the previous dates that were not showing before as well. It doesn't happen to all users.

Please note maxResults=10. Request steps are executed as follows
 # Identify latest changes registered for the user combining the following data:
 ## Get 10 latest issues created by the user (IssueSearch.java:51)
 ## Get 10 latest entries from {{changegroup}} table and translate them to issue keys (DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:393)
 ## Get 10 latest entries from jiraaction table and translate them to issue keys (DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:398)
 ## Combine results from (1.2) and (1.3) by sorting by latest issue updates and limit the results to 10 (DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:348)
 # Combine results from (1.4) and (1.1) getting the list of issues that were subject to latest user changes (IssueFinder.java:51)
 # Extract activities for identified issues (JiraStreamsActivityProvider.java:101)

h3. Expected Results
It would show all the activities in chronological order correctly.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't show the proper activities per day chronologically as expected, hiding a few dates that will only appear after clicking Show More a few times.

h3. Identified bugs:
 # Step (1.4) from the workflow above sorts previously calculated results by latest update date *ignoring* the author of the changes. The result is then trimmed to 10 issues only.
 # The code in general executes the same action several times as it's first getting the latest activities for a given user from database, then translates the activities into issue keys and then calculates the activities one more time but now based only on previously identified issue keys.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Activity Stream gadget doesn't properly show all activities of a user profile, suppressing a few days until clicking Show More.

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, in case that there are several users that have a similar Name or Email Address, searching for those users, it will be listed in ascending alphabetical format. Due to this, if we search for example a user with letter 'K' as the first character, it will be listed down below, require to scroll the result to click on the user. Also, even though the search string matches the Display Name or Email Address, this does not get the user prioritized.

h3. Suggested Solution
To reserve the first result of the User Search function for the most match user based on the search string.

h3. Note
Due to this and JIRA Service Desk limitation in showing the User Search List result in the portal, there is a possibility that the user can't be selected as it is not one of the results.

h3. Problem definition
Currently, users can create new priorities and link them to icons only via user interface. However, there is no published REST API endpoint that would allow user to:
* Add new / modify existing priorities and priority schemes
* Link icon's URL and change the existing one
** icon URLs can be modified directly through database (priority table), but this still requires a restart and also, introduces risk of data corruption.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When text looking like an issue key is searched for via the Quick Search bar, Jira will assume it's a valid key and attempt to load the issue, even though that issue key or project with key does not exist. 

The end result of this is that you cannot search for an issue-key like string directly, if you have that string somewhere in a ticket and want to search for it, for example, in the summary field or description field. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a test project, (EG TEST), create an issue with summary field containing an issue key like string, for example "This is a test issue BROKEN-01" 
 # Note there is no project in the system with key "BROKEN"
 # In the Jira quick search bar, enter "BROKEN-01"
 # Note that the auto complete searches for and shows our correct issue. However, press ENTER to complete the search

h3. Expected Results

We are taken to the Jira issue browser with the search results, in this case showing the issue with the issue key like string.
h3. Actual Results

Jira assumes we want the non-existent issue BROKEN-01, and redirects us to [http://JIRA/browse/BROKEN-01|http://jira/browse/BROKEN-01], resulting the message "You can't view this issue"
h3. Workaround

Do not press ENTER after searching for the issue key like string. Rather, click on the result that shows in the auto complete popup below the search bar.
fields.summary: In Quick Search, searching for issue key like strings assumes we want that issue, rather than searching for that issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Since about Jira 7.3, Jira Server and Data Center installations have started including the whisper plugin. This plugin provides in product notifications in applications like Jira. These notifications are controlled by Atlassian. These can be used to inform users of new features or notify users of critical updates.

As a system administrator, I want to control which of my Jira end users see this message, and be able to stop showing users this message when I choose.
h3. Suggested Solution

Update whisper plugin to provide more granular control over these notifications by a system administrator. Such as the ability to dismiss a specific message from appearing for other users. And the ability to see which user-roles will see a specific message
h3. Why this is important

It can help provide system administrators more control over the messages and content that appear to their end users. Many times end users could be seeing messages that urge them to upgrade Jira when Jira has already been upgraded, or when that user does not have privileges to actually perform the upgrade themselves. In turn these can lead to many users reaching out to the Jira system admin to remind them of an upgrade.
h3. Workaround

It is possible to disable the whisper plugin entirely, however this is not recommended by Atlassian as it would prevent the system from getting any such notifications at all.
fields.summary: As a Jira System Admin, I want more control over in product notifications (aka whisper notifications) that appear to all my end users

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no functionality in Jira to determine _which_ threads are consuming high amounts of memory in frequent full GC/OoM situations without having to manually parse through heap dumps.

Tracking _exact_ memory usage by calculating the dominator tree is expensive, but probing per-thread allocation rates might be a useful signal for identifying suspect threads.
h2. Suggested Solution
 # Extend app diagnostics to probe threads for memory allocations.
 # Add new alerting property to mark threads exceeding a threshold allocation rate.

This may allow for more rapid identification of problems by highlighting specific threads with high memory allocation rates that can be correlated to access logs and thread dumps to identify users and activities that are expensive in terms of heap consumption.
fields.summary: Add memory probing to Atlassian Diagnostics bundled plugin

h3. Issue Summary
If the JIRA instance with MySQL is set as Italian System Language, when using the Health Check, the Database Collation will display as error:
 !DBColl.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.13.5
* Supported MySQL with supported collation
* System Language = Italian

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.13.5
# Connect JIRA to Supported MySQL Database
# Set the System Language to Italian
# Go to *Administration > System > Troubleshooting and Support Tools*
# Check the Database Collation section

h3. Expected Results
Shows that the collation is supported

h3. Actual Results
Showing an error:
 !DBColl.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
*Option 1:*
Set the following in the 'set JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=' section of the *setenv.sh*/*setenv.bat* file and restart JIRA
{noformat}
-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US
{noformat}

*Option 2:*
Use the unofficial patched Italian language pack (done by [~mfernandes@atlassian.com]. Thanks!):
# Shutdown Jira
# Replace the Italian language pack file on {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}} with the modified one:  [^jira-core-language-pack-it_IT-7.13.4.v20190530113207.jar] .

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting a property through {{BaseEntityPropertyService#setProperty(final ApplicationUser user, @Nonnull final SetPropertyValidationResult propertyValidationResult)}} and skipping the security check, it's not possible to do so without getting an error (You do not have permission to browse issues in this project) because there’s no way to pass EntityPropertyOptions

h3. Environment
* Code base can be seen in {{master}}, I'm guessing it's 8.2 or 8.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
From the app developer
{quote}
If you want to set a property and skip the security check it is not possible to do so without getting an error. The problem here is not the null user value itself but the fact that setProperty() has no way to pass EntityPropertyOptions).

Here is the problem:

Setting a property is a two-step process:

# Call validateSetProperty() with property input (skip security check possible - method takes EntityPropertyOptions)
# Call setProperty() - if input is valid (skip security check NOT possible, because *method implementation does not take EntityPropertyOptions and ends with a call to getProperty() version without EntityPropertyOptions)

Because step 2 has no option to pass EntityPropertyOptions to skip the security check trying to set a property without security checks will always fail (Error will be: You do not have permission to browse issues in this project.)
{quote}

h3. Notes
* Issue originally raised in Developer Support.
* Discussion added as an internal comment

h3. Workaround
From app developer:
{quote}
We simply ignoring the permission error - however, this is not good because we cannot tell the user if there is actually a problem with the set property operation in our plugin upgrade task
{quote}
fields.summary: Setting a property through BaseEntityPropertyService#setProperty and skipping the security check results in an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When logging work with small numbers, Jira fails to display them although the values are stored on database. When editing the worklog that was created, Jira will not show anything on the time spent box.


h3. Environment

 * Time estimate needs to be displayed on hours.
 * Default time tracking unit needs to be minutes 

 !Screen Shot 2019-08-05 at 11.14.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the *Display Format* on the [Time Tracking settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/configuring-time-tracking-828788203.html] to *Hours*
# Create a worklog with *0.09m* (to log 5 seconds)
# See the worklog entry

h3. Expected Results

Logged value is displayed on log work tab.

h3. Actual Results

Log work tab shows an entry for the worklog, but doesn't show any value:
| !Screen Shot 2019-08-05 at 11.15.03.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
Use the *pretty* display format:
| !Screen Shot 2019-08-05 at 11.18.11.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Notes
When you log work as 0.09m (5 seconds) Jira cannot display that value in Hours (approx. 0.00139h). You can see the time logged on the database using this query:
{code:sql}
SELECT issueid, timeworked, created FROM worklog WHERE timeworked = 5 ORDER BY created DESC;
{code}
fields.summary: Work Log time estimate fails to display.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pre-seeding cluster.properties in a new install causes Jira to fail to start. 

I have marked this critical as it affects the [Jira quickstarts|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/], which rely on pre-seeding the database and clustering.

h3. Environment

Linux (confirmed on Amazon Linux 2 on EC2, and Ubuntu 18.04 in VirtualBox).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Install Ubuntu 18.04 on a local VM.
* Install packages {{postgresql-10}} and {{openjdk-8-jre}}
* Setup Postgres, add a blank database {{jira}}
* Download {{atlassian-jira-software-8.3.1.tar.gz}} and unpack
* Create {{\~/jira/}} and {{\~/jira-shared/}}
* Create the files {{\~/jira/dbconfig.xml}} and {{\~/jira/cluster.properties}} (see attached for versions I used).
* {{export JIRA_HOME=\~/jira/}}
* Start Jira with {{./bin/start-jira.sh -fg}}

Connecting to http://localhost:8080 hangs indefinitely.

The logs contain a lot log lines like:
{noformat}
2019-08-05 04:16:22,940 http-nio-8080-exec-2 WARN anonymous 256x3x1 35c7u6 10.0.2.2 /secure/SetupDatabase!default.jspa [n.sf.ehcache.Cache] Data availability impacted:
****************************************************************************************
************************** removeAll called on a pinned cache **************************
****************************************************************************************
{noformat}

Additionally, the following lines appear, however they also appear in a clean install (no-pre-seeding):

{noformat}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: org.apache.commons.dbcp2.PoolingDataSource$PoolGuardConnectionWrapper.getPrepareThreshold()
{noformat}

h3. Notes

* This occurs on both Software and ServiceDesk, but not on Core.
* Seeding only {{dbconfig.xml}} does not seem to produce the error.
* Two logs have been attached, one from a clean (unseeded) install, and from a run seeded with both {{dbconfig.xml}} and {{cluster.properties}}.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 8.3.0+: Pre-seeding cluster.properties causes Jira Software to fail to start

fields.description:
h3. Summary

@mention and general update emails from batch notification are not grouped together, despite having the same email subject.
 The issue only happen to email with double-byte characters in the subject.

!outlook_grouping.png!
h3. How to Replicate
 # Enable batching email notifications
 # Create an issue with summary in Korean characters
 # Add a regular comment to the issue
 # Add a comment with @mention in the issue
 # Check the emails from mail client

h3. Investigation Done
 * We noticed the email grouping problem with MS Outlook and Thunderbird. Problem is not affecting the grouping in MacOS Mail client.
 * From the emails that we received from batch notifications, we can confirm that the subject line looks identical from the email client.
 * Reviewing the email headers, we noticed the differences in the email subject in encoded format (though they decoded to the same value):
 ** @mention email subject
{code:java}
 Subject: =?UTF-8?Q?[Test_JIRA_-_Ignore_it]_Upd?= =?UTF-8?Q?ates_for_WT-1?=
 =?UTF-8?Q?1:_=EB=A1=9C=EC=A7=81_=EC=88=98?=
 =?UTF-8?Q?=EC=A0=95_=ED=85=8C=EC=8A=A4=ED=8A=B8_4?={code}

 * 
 ** General notification email subject:
{code:java}
 Subject: =?UTF-8?Q?[Test_JIRA_-_Ignore_it]_Upd?= =?UTF-8?Q?ates_for_WT-11?=
 =?UTF-8?Q?:_=EB=A1=9C=EC=A7=81_=EC=88=98=EC=A0=95?=
 =?UTF-8?Q?_=ED=85=8C=EC=8A=A4=ED=8A=B8_4_?={code}

 * The header from email subject in English:
{code:java}
 Subject: [Test JIRA - Ignore it] Updates for WT-10: As a developer, I can
 update story and task status with drag and drop (click the triangle at far
 left of this story to show sub-tasks) {code}

h3. Please Help With

Please let us know if we can standardise the encoded email subject or encode it one-go, instead of doing it in chunks e.g:
{code:java}
 Subject: 
 =?UTF-8?Q?[Test_JIRA_-_Ignore_it]_(WT-11)_=EB=A1=9C=EC=A7=81_=EC=88=98=EC=A0=95_=ED=85=8C=EC=8A=A4=ED=8A=B8_4?={code}
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: @mention and general update emails from batch notification are not grouped together, despite having the same email subject.

fields.description:
h3. Context
A site administrator is importing a project full of issues into Jira using the JSON import wizard. The issues come from a system that supports internal comments so some of the imported comments need to be visible to staff only.

h3. Problem
While the JSON import allows issues to have comments, they do not have any visibility property so we cannot mark comments as visible to staff group only.

h3. Solution
Add a property to comments in JSON imports that sets the group visibility in Jira, so we can set internal comments as only visible to a specific group of users who are staff.

h3. Workaround
Only alternative is to leave out the internal comments when generating the JSON for import, which means we lose content when moving issues to Jira.
fields.summary: Set comment visibility in JSON import

fields.description:
I would like to know if there is a Jira add-on to help plan a project

The tool takes into account the available capacity, the committed EPICs and the FixVersion it the following way:

For every committed EPIC (R&D commit = COMMITTED) and for every release (FixVersion), it calculated the total original estimation (of the Epic),

and it compares it to the team’s available capacity.

The bottom line would be a list of all the EPICs that make it to the release and the remaining capacity
fields.summary: Add-on for project planning

fields.description:
JIRA Administrator might not want to embed the issue collector form in a page but access the form directly instead. In some cases, their website is running on HTTPS but JIRA instance is running on HTTP, embedding HTTP content in an HTTPS page will result in some users unable to see the embedded content due to browser blocking mixed content.

The following KB article details this issue and it presents a workaround by accessing a rest endpoint to open the form directly. Unfortunately, this endpoint doesn't work anymore, the HTML code for the form is returned but it stays hidden, not showing the fields to fill.
fields.summary: Issue collector mixed content - Endpoint issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Rarely, Atlassian has issued IPN (in product notifications) for Jira Server and Data Center customers. This feature has existed in Jira since about 7.3 or 7.4. These messages could be used for letting users know about new product features, or to let Admins know about security vulnerabilities.

The nature of these messages is very short, which usually has them including one or more addition hyperlinks to a related Atlassian site, such as Community, or documentation, etc. However the dialog box that appears on an end user's screen will not display the hyperlink URL in the statusbar of the browser when you hover over it.

This is a small feature that would help us be more transparent about where a link is going, before you try to go there. There is a fear among users, coupled with the infrequency of such notifications, that maybe a link that does not indicate where it is going could be malicious.
h3. Suggested Solution

Make adjustments to the way hyperlinks are displayed in the in product notifications (whisper) so that hovering over those links shows the destination URL in the browser statusbar, like a real link.
h3. Why this is important
 * Transparency with end users. 
 * Helps to build there trust,
 * Knowing what you are clicking before you click it.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Jira In Product Notifications (aka Whisper messages) should display the destination URL in the statusbar for any hyperlinks the user hovers over

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Class {{RequestCachingGroupManager}} may accumulate too many objects in _RequestCache_ during processing 
* Users (JRASERVER-67502 )
* link.IssueLinkImpl
* QueryCacheLiteralsKey
* etc 

See more details  JRASERVER-66555


h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce the limit to number of objects stored by http request in it's cache. The default limit will be _1000_

h3. Note about the fix
The fix is _not enabled by default_. It will be applied only when [setting the JVM argument|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-945111794.html]:
{noformat}
-Djira.cache.request.bounded.enabled=true
{noformat}
Jira node restart is required.
To verify that the option was enabled correctly see if the Jira application log contains message:
{noformat}
2019-03-19 15:06:16,969 http-nio-8080-exec-1 INFO anonymous 906x1x1 - 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 / [c.a.j.cache.request.RequestCacheConfiguration] System property jira.cache.request.bounded.enabled is enabled and your requests scope caches are bounded with maxsize=1000
{noformat}

The default limit is 1000, but can be modified by setting JVM argument, e.g.:
{noformat}
-Djira.cache.request.bounded.size=2000
{noformat}
The limit won't be applied if {{jira.cache.request.bounded.enabled}} is not set.
fields.summary: Limit the number of elements in RequestCachingGroupManager cache

fields.description:
Hi,

Since the new custom field overview in Jira 8 was released (btw: great job) it's not longer possible to find an field by the field id.

When creating worfkflow functions and other stuff it's always good to use the field id instead of the name. For the other way (debugging, bug fixing) it's necessary to check which field is used. 

In the old search it was possible to open the source code from the Admin> custom field page and search for the ID. In the new version its not possible because the fields are split into single pages.

Please let the searcher at the top of the page be able to also search for the field id.

!image-2019-08-02-09-08-37-185.png!

Best regards

Manuel
fields.summary: Admin>CustomFields: Make it searchable for custom field id
